Node.definition: = a human being, as defined by the life principle that animates him/her
= causative action by which humans cause other humans or animals to move to a location relatively close to the location in focus
= an offering consisting of grain or a grain product, which usually accompanies an animal sacrifice
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= finely ground flour ◄ from only the inner kernel of the wheat, resulting in a high quality flour
= causative action by which humans cause a liquid to flow from one place to another

= high quality oil (שֶׁמֶן) ◄ extracted from the fruits of the olive tree during the first pressing; ► used as food, medicine, fuel, perfume (when mixed with spices), and other purposes; also used in various religious rituals; ≈ associated with joy, but also known for its softness, smoothness, and elusiveness
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= man; ◄ son of Amram (עַמְרָם) and Jochebed (יֹוכֶבֶד) brother of Moses (מֹשֶׁה) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי) ► first high priest (כֹּהֵן)
= person ordained (מלא) and consecrated (קדשׁ) to perform religious services on behalf of others
= action by which humans fill their hand with the amount of material that it can contain (קֹמֶץ)
= a certain quantity that fill a certain container
= amount of material that can be held in the palm of the hand
= finely ground flour ◄ from only the inner kernel of the wheat, resulting in a high quality flour

= high quality oil (שֶׁמֶן) ◄ extracted from the fruits of the olive tree during the first pressing; ► used as food, medicine, fuel, perfume (when mixed with spices), and other purposes; also used in various religious rituals; ≈ associated with joy, but also known for its softness, smoothness, and elusiveness
= causative action by which humans set alight and cause smoke to rise from the sacrificial fat parts of an animal, of grain and other offerings, including incense ► as an offering to a deity
= person ordained (מלא) and consecrated (קדשׁ) to perform religious services on behalf of others

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= relatively small part of a larger quantity of substance offered in sacrifice which is burnt on the altar as a token representing the entire quantity
= construction with a flat top, ◄ originally made out of stones that were not cut and shaped with tools, later also out of metal; ► used for burning sacrifices
= action by which humans offer something to a deity by burning it partially or in its entirety on the altar; considered to have a pleasing aroma
= a distinctive smell, which can be perceived as either pleasant or unpleasant; ≈ sometimes associated with the attitude a certain smell evokes in those who perceive it
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state in which humans, animals, plants, or objects remain in existence after part of the original quantity has disappeared or has been used or dealt with in a certain way
= an offering consisting of grain or a grain product, which usually accompanies an animal sacrifice
= man; ◄ son of Amram (עַמְרָם) and Jochebed (יֹוכֶבֶד) brother of Moses (מֹשֶׁה) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי) ► first high priest (כֹּהֵן)
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= state in which by which humans or objects have become part of the realm of God and his service ► and therefore no longer accessible to humans unless they have gone through special rituals
= state in which by which humans or objects have become part of the realm of God and his service ► and therefore no longer accessible to humans unless they have gone through special rituals
= action by which humans offer something to a deity by burning it partially or in its entirety on the altar; considered to have a pleasing aroma
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= causative action by which humans cause other humans or animals to move to a location relatively close to the location in focus
= an offering consisting of grain or a grain product, which usually accompanies an animal sacrifice
= something that has been cooked by dry heat without direct exposure to a flame, typically in an oven (תַּנּוּר)
= finely ground flour ◄ from only the inner kernel of the wheat, resulting in a high quality flour

= type of bread (לֶחֶם) shaped like a ring, ◄ made out of fine flour (סֹלֶת) and other ingredients by baking (אפה) it in an oven (תַּנּוּר) ► used as food, also sacrificed to God (usually unleavened) and then eaten by priests and Levites; ≈ regarded as high quality bread
= thin cracker like bread made without yeast
= causative action by which people combine different ingredients into one single mass; ≈ sometimes associated with confusion

= high quality oil (שֶׁמֶן) ◄ extracted from the fruits of the olive tree during the first pressing; ► used as food, medicine, fuel, perfume (when mixed with spices), and other purposes; also used in various religious rituals; ≈ associated with joy, but also known for its softness, smoothness, and elusiveness

= flat type of bread (לֶחֶם) ◄ made out of flour (סֹלֶת) and other ingredients by baking (אפה) it in an oven (תַּנּוּר) ► used as food, also sacrificed to God (unleavened) and then eaten by priests and Levites
= thin cracker like bread made without yeast

Node.gloss: to spread|to apply|to rub|to oil|to paint|to anoint
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans apply a liquid like oil or paint to an object by pouring or rubbing ► for the purpose of cleaning, preserving, beautifying, eating, or for consecrating for religious service

= high quality oil (שֶׁמֶן) ◄ extracted from the fruits of the olive tree during the first pressing; ► used as food, medicine, fuel, perfume (when mixed with spices), and other purposes; also used in various religious rituals; ≈ associated with joy, but also known for its softness, smoothness, and elusiveness
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
= an offering consisting of grain or a grain product, which usually accompanies an animal sacrifice

= a thick plate made of pottery (and later of metal), with small depressions similar to a modern waffle iron; ► it was placed on three stones between which a fire was built; bread dough was then put on its surface and cooked
= finely ground flour ◄ from only the inner kernel of the wheat, resulting in a high quality flour
= causative action by which people combine different ingredients into one single mass; ≈ sometimes associated with confusion

= high quality oil (שֶׁמֶן) ◄ extracted from the fruits of the olive tree during the first pressing; ► used as food, medicine, fuel, perfume (when mixed with spices), and other purposes; also used in various religious rituals; ≈ associated with joy, but also known for its softness, smoothness, and elusiveness
= thin cracker like bread made without yeast
= causative action by which humans break an object into small pieces (פַּת)

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= a relatively small quantity of food
= causative action by which humans cause a liquid to flow from one place to another

= high quality oil (שֶׁמֶן) ◄ extracted from the fruits of the olive tree during the first pressing; ► used as food, medicine, fuel, perfume (when mixed with spices), and other purposes; also used in various religious rituals; ≈ associated with joy, but also known for its softness, smoothness, and elusiveness
= an offering consisting of grain or a grain product, which usually accompanies an animal sacrifice
= referent to a female person or another object that is considered feminine
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
= an offering consisting of grain or a grain product, which usually accompanies an animal sacrifice
= a container, ◄ made out of metal, ► used for cooking food, possibly with a lid
= finely ground flour ◄ from only the inner kernel of the wheat, resulting in a high quality flour

= high quality oil (שֶׁמֶן) ◄ extracted from the fruits of the olive tree during the first pressing; ► used as food, medicine, fuel, perfume (when mixed with spices), and other purposes; also used in various religious rituals; ≈ associated with joy, but also known for its softness, smoothness, and elusiveness
= causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= an offering consisting of grain or a grain product, which usually accompanies an animal sacrifice
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them
= marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers

= causative action by which humans cause other humans or animals to move to a location relatively close to the location in focus
= person ordained (מלא) and consecrated (קדשׁ) to perform religious services on behalf of others

Node.gloss: to bring close|to bring near|to present|to offer
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans cause (other) humans, animals and objects to move to a location closer to a point of reference
= construction with a flat top, ◄ originally made out of stones that were not cut and shaped with tools, later also out of metal; ► used for burning sacrifices
literally: to lift up; hence: = action by which humans pick up (part of) an object with their hands
= person ordained (מלא) and consecrated (קדשׁ) to perform religious services on behalf of others
= an offering consisting of grain or a grain product, which usually accompanies an animal sacrifice

= state in which food has become sour;= ◄ due to the addition of sourdough or leaven during the production process
= a substance added to dough to make it ferment and rise; not to be used during Passover and in grain offerings
= sweet substance ◄ made either by bees, or from fruits such as dates, grapes or figs; ► much appreciated as food; ≈ associated with abundance and fertility
= causative action by which humans set alight and cause smoke to rise from the sacrificial fat parts of an animal, of grain and other offerings, including incense ► as an offering to a deity

= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= construction with a flat top, ◄ originally made out of stones that were not cut and shaped with tools, later also out of metal; ► used for burning sacrifices
literally: to go up; hence: = process by which a burnt offering is made and its smoke goes up

= an offering consisting of grain or a grain product, which usually accompanies an animal sacrifice
= white crystalline substance, mainly consisting of sodium chloride; ► normally used for seasoning or preserving food; ≈ associated with infertility of the soil but also with permanence
= white crystalline substance, mainly consisting of sodium chloride; ► normally used for seasoning or preserving food; ≈ associated with infertility of the soil but also with permanence
= a solemn agreement between two or more parties (persons, groups, nations, deities) with stipulations, blessings, and curses
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

= an offering consisting of grain or a grain product, which usually accompanies an animal sacrifice
= the earliest agricultural outcomes of the season; ► with an important function in the religious offerings system; ≈ often with a religious connotation

= uppermost part ◄ of a grain plant, ► which contains the seeds
= causative action by which humans place food items in or on a fire ► in order to expose it to its heat and make it ready to be eaten

= state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.
= grains of which the outer covering (hull) has been removed and which has been ground into coarse fragments
= newly ripened grain which has just been harvested and which has not yet been dried for storage or for grinding into flour
= causative action by which humans cause other humans or animals to move to a location relatively close to the location in focus
